dt: {bc}the edible part of something as distinguished from its covering (such as a husk or shell)
{bc}flesh of a mammal as opposed to fowl or fish

et: Middle English {it}mete{/it} "food, meal," going back to Old English, going back to Germanic {it}*mati-{/it} (whence Old Saxon {it}meti, mat{/it} "food," Old High German {it}maz{/it}, Old Norse {it}matr{/it}, Gothic {it}mats{/it}), perhaps going back to Indo-European {it}*mod-i-{/it}, derivative of a verbal base {it}*med-{/it} "become full," whence Greek {it}mestós{/it} "full, satiated"
shortdef: food; especially : solid food as distinguished from drink
the edible part of something as distinguished from its covering (such as a husk or shell)
animal tissue considered especially as food:

dt.t: he's {it}dead meat{/it} if they catch him

dt: {bc}meat (such as beef) that is red when raw
{bc}something substantial that can satisfy a basic need or appetite

dt.t: hungry for the {it}red meat{/it} of passionate partisanship

shortdef: meat (such as beef) that is red when raw
something substantial that can satisfy a basic need or appetite

dt: {bc}an edible part (such as the liver or tongue) of a slaughter animal other than skeletal muscle

shortdef: an edible part (such as the liver or tongue) of a slaughter animal other than skeletal muscle
